medical_history.chief_complaint: Mild-moderate abdominal pain following EUS for evaluation of pancreatic cysts.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began the morning after the EUS procedure when the patient noted sharp, upper abdominal pain, moderate in severity, without associated nausea or vomiting. Symptoms persisted while continuing a soft diet and included a few episodes of non-bloody loose stools.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Scleroderma, Sjogren's syndrome, Bronchiolitis Obliterans Organizing Pneumonia (BOOP), gastroparesis, bacterial overgrowth of the GI tract, chronic diarrhea, Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH), Dysautonomia, GERD, history of femoral DVT treated with 6 months of Coumadin, migraines, nephrolithiasis, and ejection fraction of 60%. Past surgical history includes laparoscopic cholecystectomy and other procedures.
